SEARCH
Module help
Package help

Class Step3AController

java.lang.Object
help.Step3AController
public class Step3AController extends Object
Controller class responsible for handling the actions of Step 3A in the cashier multi-step process.

    • Step3AController

      public Step3AController()

  • Method Details

    • handleCloseButtonAction

      private void handleCloseButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action when the close button is clicked. Closes the current stage (window).
      Parameters:
      event - The action event that triggers this method.

    • handleMinimizeButtonAction

      private void handleMinimizeButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action when the minimize button is clicked. Minimizes the current stage (window).
      Parameters:
      event - The action event that triggers this method.

    • initialize

      private void initialize() throws Exception
      Initializes the view with the selected movie and session details, and sets up the seat buttons. This method is called when the controller is initialized and sets up the interface based on the session and movie in the shopping cart.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs while fetching session or movie data.

    • fetchSoldSeats

      private List<String> fetchSoldSeats() throws Exception
      Fetches the list of sold seats for the currently selected session from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of seat labels representing the sold seats.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs while querying the database.

    • initializeSeatButtons

      private void initializeSeatButtons() throws Exception
      Initializes the seat buttons based on the availability of the seats. Marks seats as available (green), sold (red), or selected (yellow) based on their state.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs while fetching sold seat data.

    • handleSeatSelection

      private void handleSeatSelection(javafx.scene.control.Button seatButton)
      Handles the selection and deselection of a seat by the user. Updates the seat's color to yellow when selected and green when deselected.
      Parameters:
      seatButton - The button representing the selected seat.

    • updateShoppingCart

      private void updateShoppingCart()
      Updates the shopping cart with the currently selected seats. Displays the updated seat list in the UI and ensures seats are added to the cart.

    • handleAddToCartAction

      private void handleAddToCartAction() throws Exception
      Handles the action of adding selected seats to the shopping cart. Checks if the seats are already in the cart and if not, adds them, marks them as sold, and disables the seat buttons in the UI.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs while adding the seats to the cart or marking them as sold.

    • reduceHallCapacity

      private void reduceHallCapacity(int sessionId) throws Exception
      Reduces the vacant seat count for the given session by 1. If no vacant seats are available, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - the ID of the session for which the vacant seat count will be reduced
      Throws:
      SQLException - if no vacant seats are available or there is an issue updating the database
      Exception

    • getVacantSeatsForSession

      private int getVacantSeatsForSession(int sessionId) throws Exception
      Retrieves the number of vacant seats for a given session.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - the ID of the session for which to get the vacant seat count
      Returns:
      the number of vacant seats for the session
      Throws:
      SQLException - if no session is found with the provided session ID or there is an issue querying the database
      Exception

    • markSeatsAsSold

      private void markSeatsAsSold(List<String> seatLabels) throws Exception
      Marks a list of seats as sold (occupied) in the database.
      Parameters:
      seatLabels - a list of seat labels to be marked as sold
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an issue updating the database
      Exception

    • findSeatButtonById

      private javafx.scene.control.Button findSeatButtonById(String seatId)
      Finds a seat button by its seat label.
      Parameters:
      seatId - the ID of the seat to find
      Returns:
      the Button corresponding to the given seat ID, or null if no matching button is found

    • unmarkSeatsAsAvailable

      private void unmarkSeatsAsAvailable(List<String> seatLabels) throws Exception
      Marks a list of seats as available and updates the vacant seat count for the session.
      Parameters:
      seatLabels - a list of seat labels to be unmarked as sold and made available again
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an issue updating the database
      Exception

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String message)
      Displays an informational alert to the user with the given title and message.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert
      message - the message to display in the alert

    • handleNextButtonAction

      private void handleNextButtonAction() throws IOException
      Handles the action when the "Next" button is pressed. Loads the next step's FXML and updates the scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue loading the FXML file for the next step

    • handleBackButtonAction

      private void handleBackButtonAction() throws IOException
      Handles the action when the "Back" button is pressed. Unmarks confirmed seats as available and loads the previous step's FXML.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue loading the FXML file for the previous step

    • handleSignOutButtonAction

      private void handleSignOutButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the sign-out action when the user clicks the "Sign Out" button.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered when the "Sign Out" button is clicked.
